required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing LY900014 to Insulin Lispro (Humalog) in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind Comparison of LY900014 to Humalog With an Open-Label Postprandial LY900014 Treatment Group in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study is to compare the study drug LY900014 to insulin lispro (Humalog) in children and adolescents with type 1 diabetes (T1D).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) (Prandial Dosing)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c (prandial dosing)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Insulin Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in insulin dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 7-Point Self-Monitored Blood Glucose (SMBG) Values
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in 7-point SMBG values

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- T1D for at least 6 months at the screening visit.
- Have been treated with only one of the following rapid-acting insulin analogs as part of an multiple daily injection regimen for at least the last 90 days prior to the screening visit:
- insulin lispro U-100, or
- insulin aspart
- insulin glulisine or
- fast acting insulin aspart
- Have been treated with only one of the following basal insulins for at least the last 90 days prior to the screening visit:
- insulin glargine U-100 (once a day [QD] or twice a day [BID]), or
- insulin detemir U-100 (QD or BID), or
- insulin degludec U-100 (QD)
- Have a HbA1c value ≤ 9.9% at the screening visit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have current hypoglycemic unawareness or have had more than 1 episode of severe hypoglycemia within 6 months prior to the screening visit.
- Have had more than 1 emergency room visit or hospitalization due to poor glucose control within 6 months prior to the screening visit.
- Have been on a treatment regimen that includes regular human insulin, neutral protamine Hagedorn (NPH), Afrezza® (insulin human) inhalation powder, any premixed insulins or use of diluted insulins within 90 days prior to the screening visit.

link.description: A Study Comparing LY900014 to Insulin Lispro (Humalog) in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
